page.title: 20JACK CLEMO: POET
page.content:
Jack Clemo, the son of a poor clay worker, is deaf and blind. He lives near Carthew. Despite great handicaps he surpassed any doubts that he might be condemned to a life incapable of self-expression; against all odds, Jack Clemo became a renowned writer.
If you wish to get a feeling of what it is like to live in an area dominated by Chia Clay, read his poetry. It is simple and full of colloquial charm. For example, in the "Echoing Tip" he describes how china clay "like cold sloppy lava" burst through a dam causing "nearby cottagers...to scurry from rooms and gardens before the thick wave lopped over doorsteps and spoilt the pattern of canvas, carpets and easy routine."
